snippet: To avoid potentially negative press, Peter Jackson showed footage from his coming “Hobbit” film in a conventional format, instead of the boundary-pushing format the movie will use in theaters.
abstract: Director Peter Jackson shows footage from his coming Hobbit film in a conventional format at the Comic-Con fan convention in San Diego, instead of the boundary-pushing format the Warner Brothers-backed movie will use in theaters, in effort to avoid negative press; three of Hollywood's six major movie studios decide not to attend rather than risk showing footage for future movies with still-unfinished special effects.

byline.original: By BROOKS BARNES and MICHAEL CIEPLY

lead_paragraph: To avoid potentially negative press, Peter Jackson showed footage from his coming “Hobbit” film in a conventional format, instead of the boundary-pushing format the movie will use in theaters.
